Swayze's professional dance career took off in the late 1970s, when he began performing in music videos and touring with major rock bands. Swayze's film career began in the early 1980s, with roles in "The Outsiders" (1983) and "Red Dawn" (1984). Throughout the 1990s, Swayze continued to take on a range of film and television roles, including the critically acclaimed drama "Ghost" (1990) and the popular TV series "The Beast" (2009-2011). In addition to his acting career, Swayze was also a talented musician and released several albums, including the 1991 country-rock album "Don't Look Any Further."

Swayze was diagnosed with Stage IV pancreatic cancer in 2008 and passed away on September 14, 2009, at the age of 57.
